p.font: Don't forget to checkout on the last page when you finished the quiz.

text.p: Write a Python function that meets the following specification:
text.pre: def is_in(inner, outer): """ inner and outer: lists of ints Returns a list containing elements in inner that are not in outer. If all elements in inner are also in outer, returns the empty list. The list returned should be sorted in ascending order. """

ul.li: If inner = [4,4] and outer = [2,4,6], then is_in(inner, outer) returns [].
If inner = [6,4,4] and outer = [2,3,0], then is_in(inner, outer) returns [4,4,6].

text.p: Enter your definition for the function. Click the blue Submit button to make sure that you copied your code correctly and that it passes our basic tests.

problem.p: Note: An L379 or L397 error: means that your code has an infinite loop for some test case. You will receive a zero for this problem if your code has an infinite loop.

Note on Score Shown: Your code will ultimately be run on our test cases. Getting "Correct"/green check during the exam does not mean you will get full points. The test cases here ensures you do not have a copy/paste error from your IDE.
